property.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.address
property.description: The host and port that the MapReduce job tracker runsat. If "local", then jobs are run in-process as a single mapand reduce task.

property.name: mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address
property.description: MapReduce JobHistory Server Web UI host:port

property.name: mapreduce.job.maps
property.description: The default number of map tasks per job.Ignored when mapred.job.tracker is "local".

property.name: mapreduce.job.reduces
property.description: The default number of reduce tasks per job. Typically set to 99%of the cluster's reduce capacity, so that if a node fails the reduces canstill be executed in a single wave.Ignored when mapred.job.tracker is "local".

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.map.tasks.maximum
property.description: The maximum number of map tasks that will be runsimultaneously by a task tracker.

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.reduce.tasks.maximum
property.description: The maximum number of reduce tasks that will be runsimultaneously by a task tracker.

property.name: mapreduce.child.java.opts
property.description: Java opts for the task tracker child processes.The following symbol, if present, will be interpolated: @taskid@ is replacedby current TaskID. Any other occurrences of '@' will go unchanged.For example, to enable verbose gc logging to a file named for the taskid in/tmp and to set the heap maximum to be a gigabyte, pass a 'value' of:-Xmx1024m -verbose:gc -Xloggc:/tmp/@taskid@.gcThe configuration variable mapred.child.ulimit can be used to control themaximum virtual memory of the child processes.

property.name: mapred.local.dir
property.description: Directories on the local machine in which to store mapreduce temp files.
